cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi SE of Cape Canaveral, Florida and 50 mi NNW of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest, then turning north–north-west Friday and north on Saturday, skirting the Florida east coast and then paralleling / brushing the Georgia and South Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: very near or just offshore of the Georgia coast (near Savannah) Saturday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Englewood to Anclote River (FL) – Tropical Storm Watch (outside GA)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Boca Raton, FL to South Santee River, SC (includes entire Georgia coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast northward through Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) becoming hurricane-force (≥74 mph) possible late Friday night through Saturday as the center passes closest.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC surge guidance: 7–11 ft possible from Sebastian Inlet FL to Edisto Beach SC, which includes the Georgia coast and Port of Savannah.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches with isolated totals to 15 inches expected along the GA coast, producing flash-flood potential around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large battering waves, life-threatening rip currents, and the potential for isolated tornadoes in feeder bands.
